title: Luxe Golf Getaway in Shakespeare’s Birthplace
description: Escape to England’s tranquil Stratford-Upon-Avon - the birthplace of William Shakespeare - with a stay at The Stratford Park Hotel & Golf Club. Set across 130 acres of rolling countryside, this elegant 14th-century farmhouse has been converted into a luxury hotel with its very own 18-hole par 72 championship golf course. Included in your stay is daily breakfast, one dinner and GBP30 golf credit.
location_description: The Stratford Park Hotel & Golf Club
offer_address: The Stratford Park Hotel & Golf Club, Snitterfield, Stratford-upon-Avon CV37 0QE, United Kingdom

title: Heritage Stratford-upon-Avon Escape with Award-Winning Restaurant
description: Stay in the heart of Shakespeare country at The Arden Hotel, located in historic Stratford-upon-Avon, directly opposite the world-renowned Royal Shakespeare Company Theatres. Dine at the award-winning No. 44 Brasserie for exquisite plates of locally sourced ribeye steak, daily fresh seafood and handmade pasta, or enjoy a drink any time of day at The Club Bar. In between explorations, spend time on the all-weather terrace or enjoy afternoon tea in the lounge.
offer_address: Waterside, Stratford Upon Avon, Warwickshire CV37 6BA, United Kingdom

title: Modern Manor in Historic Stratford-upon-Avon
description:
Discover a luxurious modern retreat in the heart of Shakespeare country at the Stratford Manor in rural Warwickshire. Let the buzz of city life melt away the moment you step foot in this elegant hideaway, where you'll enjoy the use of a pristine indoor swimming pool, 22 acres of manicured gardens, and a heavenly day spa. 

When hunger strikes, The Shakespeare Restaurant serves up mouthwatering fine-dining meals, while for a more casual affair, head to The Terrace Bar for a drink or a refined Afternoon Tea (additional cost). A mere five minutes from Stratford Manor is the historic birthplace of William Shakespeare, Stratford-upon-Avon. Spend days exploring: see a show at the Royal Shakespeare company, visit Shakespeare's birthplace,  stroll around Mary Arden’s Farm and browse independent shops and boutiques in the centre of the town.
offer_address: Warwick Rd, Stratford-upon-Avon CV37 0PY, United Kingdom

title: Stylish Stratford-upon-Avon Stay Opposite Shakespeare's Last Home
description: Bask in the energy of Stratford-upon-Avon's vibrant Elizabethan history with a stay at Hotel Indigo Stratford-upon-Avon, an IHG Hotel, a modern city gem that will put you right in the heart of the birthplace of Shakespeare. An abundance of restaurants, shops, trendy bars and iconic sights are within easy reach, and the hotel's modern facilities include a traditional ‘field to fork’ British pub, exquisite private garden, library and fitness centre - making this the perfect place for an exciting break.
location_description: Hotel Indigo Stratford Upon Avon, an IHG Hotel
offer_address: 4 Chapel Street, Stratford Upon Avon, CV37 6HA, United Kingdom

title: UK Stylish Stratford-upon-Avon Riverside Escape
description: There’s no better launchpad to your Shakespeare quest than the centrally located Crowne Plaza Stratford Upon Avon, an IHG Hotel, a stylish escape resting beside the River Avon. Wander through time in this Tudor town in search of tearooms, or witness magic at the Royal Shakespeare Company. Return to the Riverside Restaurant & Terrace and toast to the Bard with a sultry tipple or sink into a sumptuous meal, as you slip into quaint country life.
location_description: Crowne Plaza Stratford Upon Avon, an IHG Hotel
offer_address: Bridge Foot, Stratford-upon-Avon CV37 6YR, United Kingdom
